title: The River That Divides
author: Amadou Diallo
content: On one side of the Niger River, farmers grow rice with ancient techniques. On the other, mechanized agriculture drains the water. What happens when tradition meets modernity in a drying climate?

title: Two Schools, One Language
author: Aisha Touré
content: In a border town, children attend two different schools — one teaches in French, the other in Arabic. They play together, but their futures pull them in opposite directions.

title: The Market of Many Tongues
author: Idrissa Keita
content: Women trade in five languages at the Gao market. Each stall tells a story of migration, survival, and subtle competition. Unity in commerce, but division in trust.

title: The Last Baobab
author: Fatima Aboubacar
content: Elders say the great baobab is sacred. Developers say it blocks progress. When the chainsaws arrive, the village splits — youth on one side, elders on the other.

title: Solar Panels or Candles?
author: Moussa Traoré
content: One village embraces solar energy. The next prefers kerosene lamps. Not because of cost — but because fire is part of their rituals. Light divides as much as it illuminates.

title: The Great Tree Planting Pact
author: Children of the Sahel
content: Five villages, once rivals, unite to plant 10,000 trees. They share seeds, water, and songs. A new generation learns: roots grow deeper when planted together.

title: The Radio That Connects
author: Radio Sahel Team
content: A community radio broadcasts in five languages. Farmers share weather tips. Women trade recipes. A simple antenna becomes a bridge across borders.

title: The Water Well of Unity
author: Engineers Without Borders
content: When drought hits, three villages dig one deep well. They create a shared schedule, guarded by elders from all sides. Water becomes a covenant, not a conflict.

title: Grandmothers’ Wisdom Circle
author: Sahel Elders Network
content: Elders from Mali, Niger, and Burkina Faso meet under a tamarind tree. They record oral histories together. Their message: 'We are not one people — but we are one purpose.'

title: The Green Wall Rises
author: AU Sahel Initiative
content: From Senegal to Djibouti, 20 countries plant a wall of trees. Satellite images show green spreading. It’s not just ecology — it’s diplomacy in action.
